perturbation.changed_text:
10.  LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTY
10.1 EXCEPT FOR A BREACH OF SECTION 8 (CONFIDENTIALITY), IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, PUNITIVE, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, NOR FOR ANY DAMAGES RELATING TO LOST DATA, LOST PROFITS, ADVERTISING OR PROMOTIONAL COSTS, TERMINATION OF EMPLOYEES, SALARIES OF EMPLOYEES OR SEVERANCE PAYMENTS, CREATION OF CUSTOMER BASE, OR FUTURE EXPECTATIONS OR OTHER ECONOMIC ADVANTAGE, HOWSOEVER ARISING AND REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, WARRANTY OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) OR UNDER ANY OTHER THEORY OF LIABILITY IN LAW OR IN EQUITY.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause 'EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES' allows for a limitation of liability even when a party has prior knowledge of potential damages, which may violate the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, and potentially contradict laws regarding knowing and willful misconduct. It creates a loophole for liability avoidance that could be deemed unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, potential unconscionability under contract law.

perturbation.changed_text: 10.4 THE WARRANTIES, IF ANY, PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT (INCLUDING THE APPENDICES AND CHANNEL NOTIFICATION DOCUMENTS) OR AS PROVIDED WITH THE PRODUCTS ARE GIVEN IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER McDATA Corporation Standard Terms of Reseller Agreement June 2004 4 WARRANTIES, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF NONINFRINGEMENT OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, ALL OF WHICH ARE HEREBY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMED AND EXCLUDED.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'MERCHANTABILITY' from the disclaimer of warranties removes a key consumer protection. The implied warranty of merchantability ensures products are fit for their ordinary purpose. Its omission violates the implied warranty of merchantability and the implied warranty of fitness for a particular purpose which is often required under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), which has been adopted in most US states, including Colorado, the governing law of this agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranty of Merchantability (UCC 2-314), Colorado Revised Statutes regarding implied warranties.
